pullRequest.title: remove snapshot-or-not logic from gradle configuration
pullRequest.bodyText:
This removes the code from the build configurations that would decide whether or not to call a module build a snapshot based on the current git branch, because #4037.
It also includes #4032, which is bad for separation of concerns, but good for reducing the number of times we have to go through the cycle of review and maybe-rebuild-a-lot-of-modules.
How to test
build some modules,
make sure the version in the name of the jar file matches the one in its source module.txt, whether or not it has -SNAPSHOT.
maybe run the generatePomFile task and look at the <version> element in there too.
there's also some stuff about choosing which repository we publish to that should probably be tested by someone who knows how the repositories work.

commit.message:
feat(build): use gestalt's parser for module.txt

It has the deserializer to give us type-safe access to this structure.
And it will come in handy when we want to inspect the dependencies more thoroughly.
feat(build): use module.txt dependency versions when defining gradle dependencies
fix(build): require module's "optional" dependencies while running their tests
feat(build): better message on modules.txt errors, fixes #4018

chore(build): use map-syntax for these extra props that are only accessed from other scopes

otherwise kotlin warns they are unused

feat(build): use version as given from version.txt instead of adding -SNAPSHOT based on git branch

fixes #4037

nodes.bodyText:
isChanging = true - hack for maven's SNAPSHOTs. (download newest SNAPSHOT from repo)
For releases it is not needed.

I think about remove snaphots anywhere :D.
It is maven way for multimodule project(I think).
We should probably introduce pure test dependencies in module land... a task for another day ^^
I somehow like that this code is gone now 🙃 still being a bit afraid of what happens to module build chaos 🙈

commit.message:
chore(gradle): update idea-ext gradle plugin to 0.8.1

not specific to this branch, just something I tried to fix gradle import errors.

fix(gradle): don't force all dependencies to be "changing"

Dependencies pulled from maven repositories with `-SNAPSHOT` versions are implicitly treated as changing without need for this override.

fix(gradle): rely on engine-module.txt to tell us if the version is a snapshot

for consistency with other modules.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into feat/versioned-mod-deps

# Conflicts:
#	.idea/.gitignore

chore (build): stop overriding the module cache lifetime

See discussion in https://github.com/MovingBlocks/Terasology/pull/4039#issuecomment-678582262

chore (build): remove stray comment

don't worry about putting extra work into syncing the versions among subprojects. I think the depenecy resolver will work it out.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/develop' into feat/versioned-mod-deps

# Conflicts:
#	.idea/.gitignore
